newsitem.title: USA: Clinton says he may ask Dole for a loan.
newsitem.headline: Clinton says he may ask Dole for a loan.

text.p: If Bob Dole has any more spare money left after loaning House Speaker Newt Gingrich $300,000, cash-strapped President Clinton would like to be his next customer.
"Actually, I was thinking of calling Sen. Dole this afternoon -- you know, Chelsea is about to go off to college and it's pretty expensive," Clinton said.
That was the president's tongue-in-cheek response when asked his reaction to the unusual announcement Thursday that Dole had loaned Gingrich $300,000 to pay an ethics fine.
As of the end of 1996, Clinton had unpaid legal bills of more than $2.25 million from the Whitewater affair and other legal proceedings.
His 17-year-old daughter Chelsea is soon to decide which university she will attend next fall.
On a serious note, Clinton said the way Gingrich paid off the ethics fine was an internal matter for the House of Representatives to consider.
"They have certain rules, certain standards, and they will have to decide whether it complies with those rules and standards," he said.
